intro: Amitostigma pinguicula, commonly known as the fat leek, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in meadows and forested areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
